definitions.definition: The act of enforcing; compulsion.
A giving force to; a putting in execution.
That which enforces, constraints, gives force, authority, or effect to; constraint; force applied.

A statement that, when taken in context, may actually mean something different from, or the opposite of, what is written literally; the use of words expressing something other than their literal intention, often in a humorous context.
Dramatic irony: a theatrical effect in which the meaning of a situation, or some incongruity in the plot, is understood by the audience, but not by the characters in the play.
Ignorance feigned for the purpose of confounding or provoking an antagonist; Socratic irony.
The state of two usually unrelated entities, parties, actions, etc. being related through a common connection in an uncommon way.
Contradiction between circumstances and expectations; condition contrary to what might be expected.
Of or pertaining to the metal iron.
definitions.example: The food had an irony taste to it.

definitions.definition: A point; the sharp end or top of anything that terminates in a point; as, the peak, or front, of a cap.
The highest value reached by some quantity in a time period.
definitions.example: The stock market reached a peak in September 1929.

definitions.definition: The top, or one of the tops, of a hill, mountain, or range, ending in a point.
definitions.example: They reached the peak after 8 hours of climbing.

definitions.definition: The whole hill or mountain, especially when isolated.
The upper aftermost corner of a fore-and-aft sail.
definitions.example: peak-brails

definitions.definition: The narrow part of a vessel's bow, or the hold within it.
The extremity of an anchor fluke; the bill.
A local maximum of a function, e.g. for sine waves, each point at which the value of y is at its maximum.
To reach a highest degree or maximum.
definitions.example: Historians argue about when the Roman Empire began to peak and ultimately decay.

definitions.definition: To rise or extend into a peak or point; to form, or appear as, a peak.
To raise the point of (a gaff) closer to perpendicular.
Maximal, maximally quintessential or representative; constituting the culmination of
Bad
Unlucky; unfortunate
To become sick or wan.
To acquire sharpness of figure or features; hence, to look thin or sickly.
To pry; to peep slyly.
Wampum.
That branch of government which is responsible for maintaining the courts of law and for the administration of justice.
Of or relating to the administration of justice.
Of or relating to the court system or the judicial branch of government.
Specified by a civil bill court under the terms of the Land Law (Ireland) Act, 1881
Of or relating to judgeship or the judiciary, the collective body of judges.
Mankind; human beings as a group.
The human condition or nature.
The quality of being benevolent; humane traits of character; humane qualities or aspects.
Any academic subject belonging to the humanities.
definitions.example: Philosophy is a humanity while psychology is a science.

definitions.definition: A low spectrum of sound tones.
definitions.example: Peter adjusted the equalizer on his audio equipment to emphasize the bass.

definitions.definition: A section of musical group that produces low-pitched sound, lower than the baritone and tenor.
definitions.example: The conductor preferred to situate the bass in the middle rear, rather than to one side of the orchestra.

definitions.definition: One who sings in the bass range.
definitions.example: Halfway through middle school, Edgar morphed from a soprano to a bass, much to the amazement and amusement of his fellow choristers.

definitions.definition: An instrument that plays in the bass range, in particular a double bass, bass guitar, electric bass or bass synthesiser.
definitions.example: The musician swung the bass over his head like an axe and smashed it into the amplifier, creating a discordant howl of noise.

definitions.definition: The clef sign that indicates that the pitch of the notes is below middle C; a bass clef.
definitions.example: The score had been written without the treble and bass, but it was easy to pick out which was which based on the location of the notes on the staff.

definitions.definition: To sound in a deep tone.
Of sound, a voice or an instrument, low in pitch or frequency.
definitions.example: The giant spoke in a deep, bass, rumbling voice that shook me to my boots.

definitions.definition: The perch; any of various marine and freshwater fish resembling the perch, all within the order of Perciformes.
The fibrous inner bark of the linden or lime tree, used for making mats.
Fibers from other plants, especially palm trees
Anything made from such fibers, such as a hassock, basket or thick mat.
Exceedingly violent, severe, ferocious, cruel or savage.
definitions.example: A fierce storm battered the coast.

definitions.definition: Resolute or strenuously active.
definitions.example: We made a fierce attempt to escape.

definitions.definition: Threatening in appearance or demeanor.
definitions.example: The lion gave a fierce roar.

definitions.definition: (rural) Excellent, very good.
definitions.example: Q: "How was the party last night?" A: "Fierce!"

definitions.definition: Of exceptional quality, exhibiting boldness or chutzpah.
definitions.example: Tyra said to strike a pose and make it fierce.

definitions.definition: (rural) Extremely; very.
definitions.example: It was fierce cold last night.

definitions.definition: Domesticated bovine animals (cows, bulls, steers etc).
definitions.example: Do you want to raise cattle?

definitions.definition: Certain other livestock, such as sheep, pigs or horses.
People who resemble domesticated bovine animals in behavior or destiny.
(English law, sometimes countable) chattel
definitions.example: goods and cattle

definitions.definition: Used in restricted contexts to refer to the meat derived from cattle.
A person with long experience of a particular activity.
A group, animal, etc. with long experience of a particular activity.
A person who has served in the armed forces, especially an old soldier who has seen long service; also called a war veteran to distinguish from veterans that weren't in armed conflict.
Having had long experience, practice, or service.
Of or relating to former members of the military armed forces, especially those who served during wartime.
A turning over or upside-down; inversion.
The overturning or overthrow of some institution or state of affairs; ruin.
To turn over, capsize or upset.
To overthrow or destroy.
To reverse (a decision); to overrule or rescind.
To diminish the significance of a previous defeat by winning; to make a comeback from.
Equipment or paraphernalia, especially that used for an athletic endeavor.
Clothing; garments.
Goods; property; household items.
A wheel with grooves (teeth) engraved on the outer circumference, such that two such devices can interlock and convey motion from one to the other; a gear wheel.
A particular combination or choice of interlocking gears, such that a particular gear ratio is achieved.
A configuration of the transmission of a motor car so as to achieve a particular ratio of engine to axle torque.
Recreational drugs, including steroids.
Stuff.
Business matters; affairs; concern.
Anything worthless; nonsense; rubbish.
To provide with gearing; to fit with gears in order to achieve a desired gear ratio.
To be in, or come into, gear.
To dress; to put gear on; to harness.
(usually with to or toward(s)) To design or devise (something) so as to be suitable (for a particular type of person or a particular purpose).
definitions.example: They have geared the hotel mainly at tourists.

definitions.definition: To borrow money in order to invest it in assets.
Great or fantastic

A platform mounted on two shafts, or a more elaborate construction, designed to be carried by two (or more) people to transport one (in luxury models sometimes more) third person(s) or (occasionally in the elaborate version) a cargo, such as a religious idol.
(collective) The offspring of a mammal born in one birth.
Material used as bedding for animals.
definitions.example: sleep in the litter

definitions.definition: Collectively, items discarded on the ground.
definitions.example: drop litter

definitions.definition: Absorbent material used in an animal's litter tray
definitions.example: the cat's litter

definitions.definition: Layer of fallen leaves and similar organic matter in a forest floor.
A covering of straw for plants.
To drop or throw trash without properly disposing of it (as discarding in public areas rather than trash receptacles).
definitions.example: By tossing the bottle out the window, he was littering.

definitions.definition: To scatter carelessly about.
To strew (a place) with scattered articles.
To give birth to, used of animals.
To produce a litter of young.
To supply (cattle etc.) with litter; to cover with litter, as the floor of a stall.
To be supplied with litter as bedding; to sleep or make one's bed in litter.
A place from which something can be viewed.
definitions.example: Perched on the edge of the cliff was a hidden outlook.

definitions.definition: The view from such a place.
An attitude or point of view.
definitions.example: He has a positive outlook on life.

definitions.definition: Expectation for the future.
definitions.example: The outlook for temperature rises is worrying.

definitions.definition: To face or look in an outward direction.
To look at (someone) so long or intently that they look away; to win or prevail over (someone or something).
To be more attractive than (someone or something).
To inspect throughly; to select.
To look beyond (something).
A governmental unit created on land of another country owned by colonists from a country.
A settlement of emigrants who move to a new place, but remain culturally tied to their place of origin
Region or governmental unit created by another country and generally ruled by another country.
definitions.example: Bermuda is a crown colony of Great Britain.

definitions.definition: An apartment complex or neighborhood.
definitions.example: Our colony is quite small, but each apartment is large.

definitions.definition: A group of people with the same interests or ethnic origin concentrated in a particular geographic area
definitions.example: The Amana Colonies in Iowa were settled by people from Germany.

definitions.definition: A group of organisms of same or different species living together in close association.
definitions.example: a colony of specialized polyps and medusoids

definitions.definition: A local group of Beaver Scouts.
The act of consulting or deliberating; consultation
The result of consultation; determination; decision.
A council; a meeting for consultation.
Agreement; concert.
A visit, e.g. to a doctor; a consultation.
To seek the opinion or advice of another; to take counsel; to deliberate together; to confer.
To advise or offer expertise.
To work as a consultant or contractor rather than as a full-time employee of a firm.
To ask advice of; to seek the opinion of (a person)
To refer to (something) for information.
To have reference to, in judging or acting; to have regard to; to consider; as, to consult one's wishes.
To deliberate upon; to take for.
To bring about by counsel or contrivance; to devise; to contrive.
To put out of place; to disarrange.
To move something, or someone, especially to forcibly move people from their homeland.
To supplant, or take the place of something or someone; to substitute.
To replace, on account of being superior to or more suitable than that which is being replaced.
definitions.example: Electronic calculators soon displaced the older mechanical kind.

definitions.definition: (of a floating ship) To have a weight equal to that of the water displaced.
To repress
(sometimes figurative) Grip.
Understanding.
That which is accessible; that which is within one's reach or ability.
definitions.example: The goal is within my grasp.

definitions.definition: To grip; to take hold, particularly with the hand.
To understand.
definitions.example: I have never been able to grasp the concept of infinity.

definitions.definition: To take advantage of something, to seize, to jump at a chance.
The metric unit of fluid measure, equal to one cubic decimetre. Symbols: l, L, ℓ
definitions.example: You should be able to fill four cups with one litre of water.

definitions.definition: A measure of volume equivalent to a litre.
Easily broken or destroyed, and thus often of subtle or intricate structure.
definitions.example: He is a very fragile person and gets easily depressed.

definitions.definition: Feeling weak or easily disturbed as a result of illness.
To bring into contact with a substance that causes illness (a pathogen).
definitions.example: Not everyone will be infected when an epidemic strikes.

definitions.definition: To make somebody enthusiastic about one's own passion.
definitions.example: Her passion for dancing has infected me.

definitions.definition: Infected.
To be superior in strength, dominance, influence or frequency; to have or gain the advantage over others; to have the upper hand; to outnumber others.
definitions.example: Red colour prevails in the Canadian flag.

definitions.definition: To be current, widespread or predominant; to have currency or prevalence.
definitions.example: In his day and age, such practices prevailed all over Europe.

definitions.definition: To succeed in persuading or inducing.
definitions.example: I prevailed on him to wait.

definitions.definition: To avail.
A socio-economic system based on private ownership of resources or capital.
An economic system based on private ownership of the means of production and their operation for profit.

(economic liberalism) A socio-economic system based on private property rights, including the private ownership of resources or capital, with economic decisions made largely through the operation of a market unregulated by the state.

(economic liberalism) An economic system based on the abstraction of resources into the form of privately owned capital, with economic decisions made largely through the operation of a market unregulated by the state.
To form into one whole; to make entire; to complete; to renew; to restore; to perfect.
To include as a constituent part or functionality.
definitions.example: They were keen to integrate their new skills into the performance.

definitions.definition: To indicate the whole of; to give the sum or total of; as, an integrating anemometer, one that indicates or registers the entire action of the wind in a given time.
To subject to the operation of integration; to find the integral of.
To desegregate, as a school or neighborhood.
definitions.example: The refugees were well integrated into the community.

definitions.definition: To combine compatible elements in order to incorporate them.
The joint between the upper arm and the forearm.

(by extension) Any turn or bend like that of the elbow, in a wall, building, coastline, etc.; an angular or jointed part of any structure, such as the raised arm of a chair or sofa, or a short pipe fitting, turning at an angle or bent.
definitions.example: the sides of windows, where the jamb makes an elbow with the window back

definitions.definition: A detective.
Part of a basketball court located at the intersection of the free-throw line and the free-throw lane.
A hit with the elbow.
To push with the elbow.
definitions.example: He elbowed his way through the crowd.

definitions.definition: (by extension) To nudge, jostle or push.
To call upon (a person, a god) for help, assistance or guidance.
To solicit, petition for, appeal to a favorable attitude.
definitions.example: The envoy invoked the King of Kings's magnanimity to reduce his province's tribute after another drought.

definitions.definition: To call to mind (something) for some purpose.
To appeal for validation to a (notably cited) authority.
definitions.example: In certain Christian circles, invoking the Bible constitutes irrefutable proof.

definitions.definition: To conjure up with incantations.
definitions.example: This satanist ritual invokes Beelzebub.

definitions.definition: To bring about as an inevitable consequence.
definitions.example: Blasphemy is taboo as it may invoke divine wrath.

definitions.definition: To cause (a program or subroutine) to execute.
definitions.example: Interactive programs let the users enter choices and invoke the corresponding routines.

definitions.definition: A place for storing earlier, and often historical, material. An archive usually contains documents (letters, records, newspapers, etc.) or other types of media kept for historical interest.
The material so kept, considered as a whole (compare archives).
definitions.example: His archive of Old High German texts is the most extensive in Britain.

definitions.definition: Natural deposits of material, regarded as a record of environmental changes over time.
definitions.example: soil archive; peat archive

definitions.definition: To put into an archive.
definitions.example: I was planning on archiving the documents from 2001.

definitions.definition: The change of something that is defective, broken, inefficient or otherwise negative, in order to correct or improve it
definitions.example: A major reform is needed to improve the efficiency in the factory.

definitions.definition: To put into a new and improved form or condition; to restore to a former good state, or bring from bad to good; to change from worse to better
definitions.example: 1909, H. G. Wells, The History of Mr. Polly Chapter 9

definitions.definition: To return to a good state; to amend or correct one's own character or habits
definitions.example: It is hoped that many criminals, upon being freed, will eventually reform.

definitions.definition: To form again or in a new configuration.
definitions.example: The regiment reformed after surviving the first attack.

definitions.definition: A small label.
A children's chasing game in which one player (known as "it") attempts to touch another, who then becomes "it".
A skin tag, an excrescence of skin.
A type of cardboard.
Graffiti in the form of a stylized signature particular to the artist.
A dangling lock of sheep's wool, matted with dung; a dung tag.
(authorship) An attribution in narrated dialogue (eg, "he said") or attributed words (e.g. "he thought").
The last line (or last two lines) of a song's chorus that is repeated to indicate the end of the song.
The last scene of a TV program that often focuses on the program's subplot.
A vehicle number plate; a medal bearing identification data (animals, soldiers).
definitions.example: The subwoofer in the trunk was so loud, it vibrated the tag like an aluminum can.

definitions.definition: An instance of touching the baserunner with the ball or the ball in a gloved hand to rule him "out."
definitions.example: The tag was applied at second for the final out.

definitions.definition: A piece of markup representing an element in a markup language.
definitions.example: The  tag conveys sarcasm in Internet slang.

definitions.definition: A keyword, term, or phrase associated with or assigned to data, media, and/or information enabling keyword-based classification; often used to categorize content.
definitions.example: I want to add genre and artist tags to the files in my music collection.

definitions.definition: Any slight appendage, as to an article of dress; something slight hanging loosely.
A metallic binding, tube, or point, at the end of a string, or lace, to stiffen it.
The end, or catchword, of an actor's speech; cue.
Something mean and paltry; the rabble.
A sheep in its first year.
Any short peptide sequence artificially attached to proteins mostly in order to help purify, solubilize or visualize these proteins.
A person's name.
definitions.example: What's your tag?

definitions.definition: To label (something).
(graffiti) To mark (something) with one’s tag.
To remove dung tags from a sheep.
definitions.example: Regularly tag the rear ends of your sheep.

definitions.definition: To hit the ball hard.
definitions.example: He really tagged that ball.

definitions.definition: To put a runner out by touching them with the ball or the ball in a gloved hand.
definitions.example: He tagged the runner for the out.

definitions.definition: To mark with a tag (metadata for classification).
definitions.example: I am tagging my music files by artist and genre.

definitions.definition: To follow closely, accompany, tag along.
To catch and touch (a player in the game of tag).
To fit with, or as if with, a tag or tags.
To fasten; to attach.
A decoration drawn over some Hebrew letters in Jewish scrolls.
A higher-pitched or stronger articulation of a particular syllable of a word or phrase in order to distinguish it from the others or to emphasize it.
definitions.example: In the word "careful", the accent is placed on the first syllable.

definitions.definition: Emphasis or importance in general.
definitions.example: At this hotel, the accent is on luxury.

definitions.definition: A mark or character used in writing, in order to indicate the place of the spoken accent, or to indicate the nature or quality of the vowel marked.
definitions.example: The name Cézanne is written with an acute accent.

definitions.definition: Modulation of the voice in speaking; the manner of speaking or pronouncing; a peculiar or characteristic modification of the voice, expressing emotion; tone.

The distinctive manner of pronouncing a language associated with a particular region, social group, etc., whether of a native speaker or a foreign speaker; the phonetic and phonological aspects of a dialect.
definitions.example: a broad Irish accent

definitions.definition: (sign languages) A distinctive manner of producing a sign language, such as someone who does not normally use a certain sign language might have when using it.
definitions.example: 2015 December 3, [./http//www.pri.org/stories/2015-12-03/philadelphia-accent-sign-language There's a distinctly Philadelphia accent in American Sign Language]

definitions.definition: A word; a significant tone or sound.
(usually plurale tantum) Expressions in general; speech.
Stress laid on certain syllables of a verse.
A regularly recurring stress upon the tone to mark the beginning, and, more feebly, the third part of the measure.
A special emphasis of a tone, even in the weaker part of the measure.
The rhythmical accent, which marks phrases and sections of a period.
The expressive emphasis and shading of a passage.
A mark used to represent specific stress on a note.
A mark placed at the right hand of a letter, and a little above it, to distinguish magnitudes of a similar kind expressed by the same letter, but differing in value, as y', y''.
A mark at the right hand of a number, indicating minutes of a degree, seconds, etc., as in 12' 27'', meaning twelve minutes and twenty-seven seconds.
A mark used to denote feet and inches, as in 6' 10'', meaning six feet ten inches.
Emphasis laid on a part of an artistic design or composition; an emphasized detail, in particular a detail in sharp contrast to its surroundings.
A very small gemstone set into a piece of jewellery.
A distinctive feature or quality.
Utterance.
To express the accent of vocally; to utter with accent.
To mark emphatically; to emphasize; to accentuate; to make prominent.
To mark with written accents.
One with liberal views, supporting individual liberty (see Wikipedia's article on Liberalism).
Someone left-wing; one with a left-wing ideology.
A supporter of any of several liberal parties.
One who favors individual voting rights, human and civil rights, and laissez-faire markets (also called "classical liberal"; compare libertarian).

(now rare outside set phrases) Pertaining to those arts and sciences the study of which is considered to provide general knowledge, as opposed to vocational/occupational, technical or mechanical training.
definitions.example: 1983, David Leslie Wagner, The Seven liberal arts in the Middle Ages

definitions.definition: Generous; willing to give unsparingly.
definitions.example: He was liberal with his compliments.

definitions.definition: Ample, abundant; generous in quantity.
definitions.example: Add a liberal sprinkling of salt.

definitions.definition: Unrestrained, licentious.
Widely open to new ideas, willing to depart from established opinions or conventions; permissive.
definitions.example: Her parents had liberal ideas about child-rearing.

definitions.definition: Open to political or social changes and reforms associated with either classical or modern liberalism.
Something that corrects or counteracts.
The legal means to recover a right or to prevent or obtain redress for a wrong.
A medicine, application, or treatment that relieves or cures a disease.
The accepted tolerance or deviation in fineness or weight in the production of gold coins etc.
To provide or serve as a remedy for.
A device which separates a suspended, dissolved, or particulate matter from a fluid, solution, or other substance; any device that separates one substance from another.
Electronics or software that separates unwanted signals (for example noise) from wanted signals or that attenuates selected frequencies.
Any item, mechanism, device or procedure that acts to separate or isolate.
definitions.example: He runs an email filter to catch the junk mail.

definitions.definition: Self-restraint in speech.
definitions.example: He's got no filter, and he's always offending people as a result.

definitions.definition: A non-empty upper set (of a partially ordered set) which is closed under binary infima (a.k.a. meets).
definitions.example: If (1) the universal set (here, the set of natural numbers) were called a "large" set, (2) the superset of any "large" set were also a "large" set, and (3) the intersection of a pair of "large" sets were also a "large" set, then the set of all "large" sets would form a filter.

definitions.definition: To sort, sift, or isolate.
definitions.example: This strainer should filter out the large particles.

definitions.definition: To diffuse; to cause to be less concentrated or focused.
definitions.example: The leaves of the trees filtered the light.

definitions.definition: To pass through a filter or to act as though passing through a filter.
definitions.example: The water filtered through the rock and soil.

definitions.definition: To move slowly or gradually; to come or go a few at a time.
definitions.example: The crowd filtered into the theater.

definitions.definition: To ride a motorcycle between lanes on a road
definitions.example: I can skip past all the traffic on my bike by filtering.

definitions.definition: The quality of being discreet or circumspect.
definitions.example: Bob showed great discretion despite his knowledge of the affair.

definitions.definition: The ability to make wise choices or decisions.
The freedom to make one's own judgements.
definitions.example: I leave that to your discretion.

definitions.definition: A very large and destructive wave, generally caused by a tremendous disturbance in the ocean, such as an undersea earthquake or volcanic eruption. Tsunami are usually a series of waves, or wave train.
A large and generally unstoppable surge.
An assistant.
An officer who acts as assistant to a more senior one; an aide-de-camp.
Relating to the coast; on or near the coast, as a coastal town, a coastal breeze
Of or relating to operations, especially military operations.
Functioning and ready for use.
Effective or operative.
Determined by means of practical measures.
Strong aversion; intense dislike
The alimentary canal, especially the intestine.
The abdomen of a person, especially one that is enlarged
definitions.example: beer gut

definitions.definition: The intestines of an animal used to make strings of a tennis racket or violin, etc.
A person's emotional, visceral self.
definitions.example: I have a funny feeling in my gut.

definitions.definition: A class that is not demanding or challenging.
definitions.example: You should take Intro Astronomy: it's a gut.

definitions.definition: A narrow passage of water.
definitions.example: the Gut of Canso

definitions.definition: The sac of silk taken from a silkworm when ready to spin its cocoon, for the purpose of drawing it out into a thread. When dry, it is exceedingly strong, and is used as the snood of a fishing line.
To eviscerate.
definitions.example: The fisherman guts the fish before cooking them.

definitions.definition: To remove or destroy the most important parts of.
definitions.example: Congress gutted the welfare bill.

definitions.definition: Made of gut.
definitions.example: a violin with gut strings

definitions.definition: Instinctive.
definitions.example: gut reaction

definitions.definition: (interrogative) By what, in which direction; how.
definitions.example: Whereby goest thou?

definitions.definition: By which.
Where, wherein, in which.
A going of the rounds along the chain of sentinels and between the posts, by a guard, usually consisting of three or four men, to insure greater security from attacks on the outposts.
A movement, by a small body of troops beyond the line of outposts, to explore the country and gain intelligence of the enemy's whereabouts.
The guards who go the rounds for observation; a detachment whose duty it is to patrol.
Any perambulation of a particular line or district to guard it; also, the people thus guarding.
definitions.example: a customs patrol

definitions.definition: A unit of a troop, usually defined by certain ranks or age groups within the troop.
To go the rounds along a chain of sentinels; to traverse a police district or beat.
To go the rounds of, as a sentry, guard, or policeman
definitions.example: to patrol a beat

definitions.definition: The act of sparing; moderation; restraint.
Parsimony; frugal use.
An opening in a petticoat or gown; a placket.
That which has not been used or expended.
A spare part, especially a spare tire.
A superfluous or second-best person, specially (in a dynastic context) in the phrase "An heir and a spare".

The right of bowling again at a full set of pins, after having knocked all the pins down in less than three bowls. If all the pins are knocked down in one bowl it is a double spare; in two bowls, a single spare.
The act of knocking down all remaining pins in second ball of a frame; this entitles the pins knocked down on the next ball to be added to the score for that frame.
A free period; a block of school during which one does not have a class.
Scant; not abundant or plentiful.
definitions.example: a spare diet

definitions.definition: Sparing; frugal; parsimonious; not spending much money.
Being more than what is necessary, or what must be used or reserved; not wanted, or not used; superfluous.
definitions.example: I have no spare time.

definitions.definition: Held in reserve, to be used in an emergency.
definitions.example: a spare anchor; a spare bed or room

definitions.definition: Lean; lacking flesh; meager; thin; gaunt.
Very angry; frustrated or distraught.
definitions.example: The poor girl is going spare, stuck in the house all day with the kids like that.

definitions.definition: Slow.
To show mercy.
To keep.
To give up To deprive oneself of, as by being frugal; to do without; to dispense with; to give up; to part with.
To grow plants, notably crops
definitions.example: Most farmers in this region cultivate maize.

definitions.definition: To nurture; to foster; to tend.
definitions.example: They tried to cultivate an interest in learning among their students.

definitions.definition: To turn or stir soil in preparation for planting.
A unit of weight (mass) equal to 2240 pounds (a long ton) or 2000 pounds (a short ton) or 1000 kilograms (a metric ton).
A unit of volume; register ton.

In refrigeration and air conditioning, a unit of thermal power defined as 12,000 BTU/h (about 3.514 kW or 3024 kcal/h), originally the rate of cooling provided by uniform isothermal melting of one short ton of ice per day at 32 °F (0 °C).
A large amount.
definitions.example: I've got tons of work to do.

definitions.definition: A speed of 100 mph.
One hundred pounds sterling.
One hundred runs.
(etc.) One hundred points scored.
Fashion, the current style, the vogue.
Fashionable society; those in style.
The common tunny, or horse mackerel.
A structured arrangement of items within certain limits.
A plan for such arrangement.
The act of laying out something.
The process of arranging editorial content, advertising, graphics and other information to fit within certain constraints.

Possessing prominent and varied colors.
Interesting, multifaceted, energetic, distinctive.
Profane, obscene, offensive (usually in the phrase colourful language).
A firmly held belief.
A judgement of guilt in a court of law.
The state of being found or proved guilty.
The state of being wholly convinced.
To identify by or divide into classes; to categorize

definitions.definition: To declare something a secret, especially a government secret

definitions.definition: A medium-sized rodent belonging to the genus Rattus.

Any of the numerous members of several rodent families (e.g. voles and mice) that resemble true rats in appearance, usually having a pointy snout, a long, bare tail, and body length greater than about 12 cm, or 5 inches.
A person who is known for betrayal; a scoundrel; a quisling.

definitions.definition: An informant or snitch.
A scab: a worker who acts against trade union policies.
A person who routinely spends time at a particular location.

definitions.definition: A wad of shed hair used as part of a hairstyle.
A roll of material used to puff out the hair, which is turned over it.
Vagina.

definitions.definition: Short for muskrat.
(usually with “on” or “out”) To betray a person or party, especially by telling their secret to an authority or an enemy; to turn someone in.

definitions.definition: To work as a scab, going against trade union policies.
(of a dog, etc.) To kill rats.
A scratch or a score.
A place in the sea with rapid currents and crags where a ship is likely to be torn apart in stormy weather.
To scratch or score.

definitions.definition: To tear, rip, rend.
definitions.example: Ratted to shreds.

definitions.definition: Damn, drat, blast; used in oaths.
A ration.
A stamped metal disc used as a personal ornament, a charm, or a religious object.
A stamped or cast metal object (usually a disc), particularly one awarded as a prize or reward.
To win a medal.
definitions.example: He medalled twice at the Olympics.

definitions.definition: To award a medal to.
A key that may be pressed to delete something (such as text or files) from a computer.
A deletion.

definitions.definition: (recorded entertainment industry) A remainder of a music or video release.
To remove, get rid of or erase, especially written or printed material, or data on a computer or other device.
To include so that it no longer has separate existence; to overwhelm; to cause to disappear as if by swallowing up; to incorporate; to assimilate; to take in and use up.
To engulf, as in water; to swallow up.
To suck up; to drink in; to imbibe, like a sponge or as the lacteals of the body; to chemically take in.
To take in energy and convert it, as

definitions.definition: To engross or engage wholly; to occupy fully
To occupy or consume time.
Assimilate mentally.
To assume or pay for as part of a commercial transaction.
To defray the costs.
To accept or purchase in quantity.
To relate details of (an event or incident); to recount, describe (something).
To repeat (something one has heard), to retell; to pass on, convey (a message, information etc.).
To take oneself (to someone or something) for guidance or support; to appeal.
To notify someone of (particular intelligence, suspicions, illegality, misconduct etc.); to make notification to relevant authorities; to submit a formal report of.
definitions.example: For insurance reasons, I had to report the theft to the local police station.

definitions.definition: To make a formal statement, especially of complaint, about (someone).

definitions.definition: To show up or appear at an appointed time; to present oneself.
To write news reports (for); to cover as a journalist or reporter.

definitions.definition: To be accountable to or subordinate to (someone) in a hierarchy; to receive orders from (someone); to give official updates to (someone who is above oneself in a hierarchy).
definitions.example: Now that I've been promoted, I report to Benjamin, whom I loathe.

definitions.definition: To return or present as the result of an examination or consideration of any matter officially referred.
definitions.example: The committee reported the bill with amendments, or reported a new bill, or reported the results of an inquiry.

definitions.definition: To take minutes of (a speech, the doings of a public body, etc.); to write down from the lips of a speaker.
To refer.
To return or repeat, as sound; to echo.
The creation of reports, as for a business or a journal.
An act of surrendering, submission into the possession of another; abandonment, resignation.
The yielding or delivery of a possession in response to a demand.
The yielding of the leasehold estate by the lessee to the landlord, so that the tenancy for years merges in the reversion and no longer exists.
To give up into the power, control, or possession of another.
(by extension) To yield (a town, a fortification, etc.) to an enemy.
To give oneself up into the power of another, especially as a prisoner; to submit or give in.

definitions.definition: To give up possession of; to yield; to resign.

definitions.definition: To yield (oneself) to an influence, emotion, passion, etc.

definitions.definition: To abandon (one's hand of cards) and recover half of the initial bet.
For a policyholder, to voluntarily terminate an insurance contract before the end of its term, usually with the expectation of receiving a surrender value.
(grammar) The instrumental case.
A composition written or performed without lyrics, sometimes using a lead instrument to replace vocals.
Essential or central; of great importance or relevance.

definitions.definition: Pertaining to, made by, or prepared for, an instrument, especially a musical instrument (rather than the human voice).

definitions.definition: (grammar) Applied to a case expressing means or agency, generally indicated in English by by or with with the objective.

definitions.definition: To regulate, be in charge of, make decisions for, reign over.
To excel.

That rules; predominant; chief; reigning; controlling.

The company of persons who perform this dance.
A light part song, frequently with a fa-la-la chorus, common among Elizabethan and Italian Renaissance composers.
A bearing in coats of arms representing one or more balls, called bezants, plates, etc., according to colour.
Any intricate series of operations involving coordination between individuals.
To perform an action reminiscent of ballet dancing.
Producing a profit.
An organism that is able to live and develop.
Able to live on its own (as for a newborn).
Able to be done, possible.
Able to live and develop.
An action or act; something that is done.
A brave or noteworthy action; a feat or exploit.
Action or fact, as opposed to rhetoric or deliberation.

definitions.definition: A legal instrument that is executed under seal or before witnesses.

definitions.definition: To transfer real property by deed.

definitions.definition: Any animal other than a human; usually only applied to land vertebrates, especially large or dangerous four-footed ones.
(more specific) A domestic animal, especially a bovine farm animal.
A person who behaves in a violent, antisocial or uncivilized manner.
Anything regarded as larger or more powerful than one of its normal size or strength.

definitions.definition: Someone who is particularly impressive, especially athletically or physically.
(prisons) A sex offender.
Something unpleasant and difficult.
A thing or matter, especially a difficult or unruly one.
To impose arduous exercises, either as training or as punishment.
(chiefly Midwestern and northeastern US) great; excellent; powerful
A work, such as a work of fiction, published in installments, often numbered and without a specified end.
A publication issued in successive parts, often numbered and with no predetermined end.
A serial number, esp. one required to activate software.

definitions.definition: To assign a serial number to (especially of aircraft)
Having to do with or arranged in a series.

definitions.definition: Published or produced in installments.
A lyric poem.
(also in plural) The words of a song or other vocal music. The singular form often refers to a part of the words, whereas the plural form can refer to all of the words.

Of or relating to a writer of such poetry
Lyrical

Melodious

A commercially produced film to be shown in movie theaters.
Of or relating to the theatre.
Fake and exaggerated.

A recognizable natural or man-made feature used for navigation.
A notable location with historical, cultural, or geographical significance.
A major event or discovery.

Of, relating to, or belonging to a city, a citizen, or citizenship; municipal or civil.

definitions.definition: A protective substance that exists in the serum or other bodily fluid and is capable of killing microorganisms; complement.
Something (or someone) that completes; the consummation.
The act of completing something, or the fact of being complete; completion, completeness, fulfilment.
The totality, the full amount or number which completes something.
Something which completes one's equipment, dress etc.; an accessory.
The whole working force of a vessel.
Fullness (of the moon).
An angle which, together with a given angle, makes a right angle.
Something which completes, something which combines with something else to make up a complete whole; loosely, something perceived to be a harmonious or desirable partner or addition.
(grammar) A word or group of words that completes a grammatical construction in the predicate and that describes or is identified with the subject or object.
An interval which, together with the given interval, makes an octave.
The color which, when mixed with the given color, gives black (for mixing pigments) or white (for mixing light).
definitions.example: The complement of blue is orange.

definitions.definition: Given two sets, the set containing one set's elements that are not members of the other set (whether a relative complement or an absolute complement).
definitions.example: The complement of the odd numbers is the even numbers, relative to the natural numbers.

definitions.definition: One of several blood proteins that work with antibodies during an immune response.
An expression related to some other expression such that it is true under the same conditions that make other false, and vice versa.
A voltage level with the opposite logical sense to the given one.
A bit with the opposite value to the given one; the logical complement of a number.
The diminished radix complement of a number; the nines' complement of a decimal number; the ones' complement of a binary number.

definitions.definition: The radix complement of a number; the two's complement of a binary number.
definitions.example: The complement of 01100101_2 is 10011011_2.

definitions.definition: The numeric complement of a number.
definitions.example: The complement of −123 is 123.

definitions.definition: A nucleotide sequence in which each base is replaced by the complementary base of the given sequence: adenine (A) by thymine (T) or uracil (U), cytosine (C) by guanine (G), and vice versa.
definitions.example: A DNA molecule is formed from two strands, each of which is the complement of the other.

definitions.definition: Old spelling of compliment
To complete, to bring to perfection, to make whole.

definitions.definition: To provide what the partner lacks and lack what the partner provides, thus forming part of a whole.
definitions.example: I believe our talents really complement each other.

definitions.definition: To change a voltage, number, color, etc. to its complement.
Old form of compliment
A good whose appeal increases with the popularity of its complement

definitions.definition: The set of all interior points of a set.
Within any limits, enclosure, or substance; inside; internal; inner.

definitions.definition: Remote from the limits, frontier, or shore; inland.

definitions.definition: To fight (with); to struggle for victory (against).
The state of being wide.
The measurement of the extent of something from side to side.
A piece of material measured along its smaller dimension, especially fabric.
The horizontal distance between a batsman and the ball as it passes him.
The use of all the width of the pitch, from one side to the other.

definitions.definition: The highest or uppermost part of something.

definitions.definition: A child’s spinning toy; a spinning top.

definitions.definition: (heading) Someone who is eminent.
(BDSM) A dominant partner in a BDSM relationship or roleplay.
A man penetrating or with a preference for penetrating during homosexual intercourse.

definitions.definition: A top quark.

The part of a cut gem between the girdle, or circumference, and the table, or flat upper surface.
(in the plural) Topboots.
A stroke on the top of the ball.
A forward spin given to the ball by hitting it on or near the top.
(in restaurants, preceded by a number) (A table at which there is, or which has enough seats for) a group of a specified number of people eating at a restaurant.
To cover on the top or with a top.

definitions.definition: To cut or remove the top (as of a tree)

definitions.definition: To excel, to surpass, to beat.

definitions.definition: To be in the lead, to be at number one position (of).

definitions.definition: To commit suicide.

definitions.definition: To murder.

To rise aloft; to be eminent; to tower.

definitions.definition: To predominate.

definitions.definition: To excel; to rise above others.

definitions.definition: To put a stiffening piece or back on (a saw blade).
To arrange (fruit, etc.) with the best on top.

Situated on the top of something.
Best; of the highest quality or rank.

definitions.definition: Very good, of high quality, power, or rank.

definitions.definition: Rated first.

definitions.definition: Rationally right, correct.
Morally right; upright, righteous, equitable; fair.

definitions.definition: Proper, adequate.
Only, simply, merely.

definitions.definition: Used to show humility.

definitions.definition: (degree) absolutely, positively

definitions.definition: Moments ago, recently.

definitions.definition: By a narrow margin; closely; nearly.

definitions.definition: Exactly, precisely, perfectly.

To joust, fight a tournament.

definitions.definition: A bearing representing a creature something like a walrus.
To hunt seals.

definitions.definition: Anything that secures or authenticates.

definitions.definition: Confirmation or approval, or an indication of this.

A carbon copy.

definitions.definition: To embrace closely; to give a tight hug to.

definitions.definition: A supply of anything wasted or exhausted; a reinforcement.
A person enlisted for service in the army; a newly enlisted soldier.

The state of being banished from one's home or country.

Of high cost; expensive.

Funny; amusing; comical.
Relating to comedy.

definitions.definition: To plead in favour of; to defend by argument, before a tribunal or the public; to support, vindicate, or recommend publicly.
To encourage support for something.
definitions.example: I like trees, but I do not advocate living in them.

definitions.definition: (with for) To engage in advocacy.
definitions.example: We have been advocating for changes in immigration law.

definitions.definition: To descend to a surface, especially from the air.
definitions.example: The plane is about to land.

definitions.definition: To alight, to descend from a vehicle.
To come into rest.
To arrive at land, especially a shore, or a dock, from a body of water.
To bring to land.
definitions.example: It can be tricky to land a helicopter.

definitions.definition: To acquire; to secure.
To deliver.
Corridor.
Coming to a surface, as of an airplane or any descending object.
A place on a shoreline where a boat lands.
A level area at the top of a flight of stairs, or connecting one flight with another.
The act of accomplishing; completion; fulfilment.
definitions.example: the accomplishment of an enterprise, of a prophecy, etc

definitions.definition: That which completes, perfects, or equips thoroughly; acquirement; attainment; that which constitutes excellence of mind, or elegance of manners, acquired by education or training.
Something accomplished; an achievement.
(grammar) The lexical aspect (aktionsart) of verbs or predicates that change over time until a natural end point.
To produce an image or copy of.
To generate offspring (sexually or asexually), or organisms.
To produce again; to recreate.
To bring something to mind; to recall.

The state or quality of being independent; freedom from dependence; exemption from reliance on, or control by others; self-subsistence or maintenance; direction of one's own affairs without interference.
The state of having sufficient means for a comfortable livelihood.
(of a person or place) Very beautiful.
definitions.example: All the contest judges agreed that Brigitt was absolutely gorgeous.

definitions.definition: Very enjoyable, pleasant, tasty, etc.
definitions.example: Hummus is absolutely gorgeous.

definitions.definition: The act or instance of wandering.
definitions.example: to go for a wander in the park

definitions.definition: The situation where a value or signal etc. deviates from the correct or normal value.
definitions.example: baseline wander in ECG signals

definitions.definition: To move without purpose or specified destination; often in search of livelihood.
definitions.example: to wander over the fields

definitions.definition: To stray; stray from one's course; err.
definitions.example: A writer wanders from his subject.

definitions.definition: To commit adultery.
To go somewhere indirectly or at varying speeds; to move in a curved path.
Of the mind, to lose focus or clarity of argument or attention.
The science of diplomas, or the art of deciphering ancient writings and determining their age, authenticity, etc.; paleography.
Concerning the relationships between the governments of countries.
definitions.example: Albania immediately severed diplomatic relations with Zimbabwe.

definitions.definition: Exhibiting diplomacy; exercising tact or courtesy; using discussion to avoid hard feelings, fights or arguments.
definitions.example: Thoughtful corrections can be diplomatic as well as instructional.

definitions.definition: Describing a publication of a text which follows a single basic manuscript, but with variants in other manuscripts noted in the critical apparatus
definitions.example: Whereas a diplomatic edition uses as its base text a single, "best" manuscript, to which other textual evidence is collated and organized into an apparatus, a critical text of the LXX/OG [= Septuagint or Old Greek] may be described as a collection of the oldest recoverable texts, carefully restored book by book (or section by section), aiming at achieving the closest approximation to the original translations (from Hebrew or Aramaic) or compositions (in Greek), systematically reconstructed from the widest array of relevant textual data (including controlled conjecture).  The International Organization for Septuagint and Cognate Studies, Critical Editions of Septuagint/Old Greek Texts.

definitions.definition: Relating to diplomatics, or the study of old texts; paleographic.
To put in or as if in prison; confine.
To follow (a leader, inclination etc.).
To follow (in time), to be subsequent to.
To occur afterwards, as a result or effect.
definitions.example: Give three freshmen six bottles of wine, and hilarity will ensue.
